questiontext.text:
Upload Your Handwritten Calculation Work

This is the final step of your exam. Please upload clear photos or PDF scans of your handwritten work for all four questions. This upload is for verification and grading support — each question is graded individually through its own submission, but your handwritten work must be provided here as evidence of your solution process.

Checklist — Your uploads must include the following:

  • Q1 (Node-Voltage / Mesh-Current Analysis):
    • Clearly labeled node-voltage or mesh-current equations
    • All steps of solving the system of equations (substitution, elimination, or matrix methods)
    • Final answers clearly boxed or highlighted
  • Q2 (Energy Calculation):
    • Energy calculation with proper units shown at every step
    • Any intermediate steps (e.g., finding current or voltage first, integration work)
    • Final answer with correct units clearly indicated
  • Q3 (s-Domain / Transfer Function / Inverse Laplace):
    • s-domain circuit drawing with all component impedances labeled
    • Transfer function derivation showing all algebraic steps
    • Inverse Laplace transform steps (partial fraction decomposition, table look-ups, etc.)
    • Final time-domain expression clearly stated
  • Q4 (Switching Circuit / Transient Analysis):
    • Pre-switch (steady-state) analysis with initial conditions clearly identified
    • s-domain circuit setup after the switch event
    • Time-domain solution steps showing the full derivation
    • Verification step (e.g., checking initial and final values, or substituting t = 0 and t → infinity)

Instructions for Uploading:

  1. Write your name and student ID on every page.
  2. Number your pages (e.g., Page 1 of 5, Page 2 of 5, ...) and label which question each page corresponds to (e.g., "Q1", "Q3 continued").
  3. Ensure all photos are legible: use good lighting, keep the camera steady, and make sure the image is in focus before uploading.
  4. Use a dark pen (blue or black) on white paper for best legibility. Avoid pencil if possible.
  5. You may upload up to 4 files. Accepted formats: PDF, JPG, JPEG, PNG.
  6. If you have multiple pages, consider combining them into a single PDF for easier organization.

Note: This question is worth 0 points. Your handwritten work is graded through the individual question submissions (Q1–Q4). However, failure to upload legible handwritten work may affect verification of your answers.

generalfeedback.text: Thank you for uploading your handwritten work. Your submissions will be reviewed alongside your individual question responses. If any pages are illegible or missing, you may be contacted for clarification.

graderinfo.text:
Instructor Notes — Reviewing Uploaded Handwritten Work

This upload carries 0 marks and is used for verification and grading support. When reviewing submissions, check the following:

General Checks:
  • Student name and ID are present on every page
  • Pages are numbered and labeled by question
  • Images are legible (not blurry, not too dark, not cut off)
  • Work appears to be the student's own handwriting and is consistent across pages
Q1 — Node-Voltage / Mesh-Current Analysis:
  • Verify that the method chosen (node-voltage or mesh-current) is correctly set up
  • Check that KCL/KVL equations are correctly written for the chosen nodes/meshes
  • Look for a systematic solution process (not just a final answer with no work)
  • Confirm the number of equations matches the number of unknowns
Q2 — Energy Calculation:
  • Units should be tracked throughout the calculation (volts, amps, watts, joules, seconds)
  • Check for correct integration bounds if energy is computed via integration
  • Verify that intermediate values (current, voltage, power) are reasonable
Q3 — s-Domain / Transfer Function / Inverse Laplace:
  • The s-domain circuit should correctly transform all components (R stays R, L becomes sL, C becomes 1/sC, with initial conditions if applicable)
  • Transfer function derivation should follow logically from the s-domain circuit
  • Partial fraction decomposition (if used) should be algebraically correct
  • Inverse Laplace result should match standard transform pairs
Q4 — Switching Circuit / Transient Analysis:
  • Pre-switch steady-state analysis should correctly treat inductors as short circuits and capacitors as open circuits (for DC steady state)
  • Initial conditions should be correctly identified and carried into the s-domain model
  • The s-domain circuit after switching should reflect the new topology
  • Verification step: check that the student confirmed initial value (t = 0⁺) and final value (t → infinity) are consistent with their solution
Red Flags:
  • Final answers that appear correct but with no supporting work or skipped steps
  • Handwriting that changes style between questions (possible academic integrity concern)
  • Uploaded images that are screenshots of typed/digital solutions rather than handwritten work
  • Pages that appear to be photocopies of another student's work
